auth.message.refuse: You can write a short message to the refusal.

auth.registerpage.forgetPasswordMessage: Please provide your email adress and we will send you a link, which should enable you to reset your password.
charts.badCombo: This chart type doesn't work with this Common property. Try another configration.
charts.infoContent1: This page can be used to create various charts with the exact information you are interested in.
charts.infoContent2: The fields and controls on the left side of the page can be used to filter the data the chart will be working with.
charts.infoContent3: The "Chart type" dropdown lets you choose between pie, line and column charts. Under "Common property" you can select the data field which will be the common (grouping) factor in the diagram, while the "Value axis" option marks the aggregated attribute of these groups: either some sort of mean, or simply the size of the respective group (first option).
charts.infoContent4: In the case of pie and column diagrams, there are three additional options. Under "Sort by" you can toggle between ordering the groups by the Common Property or by the aggregated Value. The value entered in the "Minimum group size" field will act as an upper limit to the sizes of the categories, so groups aggregated by less values will be combined into a Category named Aggregated groups, to make your chart more transparent. This Aggregated group sometimes can grow rather big depending on your search, and more importantly on the increased Minimum group size, this is why you can toggle between showing and hiding this Aggregated group on your chart by the "Show aggregated small groups" dial.
charts.infoContent5: Note that some chart types might not work on some data types, others might not make sense. Keep trying!
charts.noResult: No results were found for your search. Try another configration or widen the search criterias.
charts.sizeSearch: priests found matching your search, from this

charts.title: Chart designer

home.cookie.mainText: This website uses cookies in order to provide basic functionalities.
home.cookie.subText: We do not collect personal data. By continuing to use this website, you consent to the usage of cookies.
home.footer1: Powered by Codespring. All rights reserved.
home.sideText1: The Priest Cadastre project's aim is to process, visualize and manage a database of the former students of the Protestant Theological Institute of Cluj-Napoca and its predecessors.
home.sideText2: The webpage simplifies the modification of data, makes advanced searches possible and provides an easy to use interface for research work.
home.sideText4: The application is implemented for the request of the Protestant Theological Institute of Cluj-Napoca, with the contribution of Codespring.
